contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary|milli-}} :''"Milli" redirects here; for the village in Azerbaijan, see [[Birinci Milli]]; for the [[Lil Wayne]] song, see [[A Milli]]; for similar-sounding words, see [[Millie]].'' '''Milli''' (symbol '''m''') is a [[SI prefix|prefix]] in the [[metric system]] denoting a factor of one thousandth (10<sup>−3</sup>).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://physics.nist.gov/Pubs/SP811/sec04.html |title=NIST Guide to the SI |accessdate=}}See section 4.3 ''Decimal multiples and submultiples of SI units: SI prefixes'', Table 5.</ref> Adopted in 1795, the prefix comes from the Latin ''mille'', meaning ''one thousand'' (the plural is ''milia''). {{SI prefixes}} ==References== {{reflist}} <!--Categories--> [[Category:SI prefixes]] [[ca:Mil·li]] [[hi:मिली-]] [[simple:Milli-]]
